PAGE.TITLE: Burning a CD or DVD on Linux

BLIST.ITEM: create a CD ISO image mkisofs -r -o foo.iso root_dir_of_data
rip the ISO image of a CD dd if=/dev/cdrom of=foobar.iso

test an ISO image mkdir /tmp/test
mount -o loop /tmp/foobar.iso /tmp/test
find the CD/DVD drive location (x,y,z) with cdrecord -scanbus and burn with (old Red Hat releases) cdrecord -v -dev=x,y,z foo.iso
burn a DVD ISO image on latest RedHat releases (I set the speed to 1 to avoid some DVD corruption problems…) sudo cdrecord -v dev=ATA:1,0,0 -dao -speed 1 toto.iso
blank a R/W CD cdrecord -dev=2,0,0 -blank=fast cdrecord -dev=2,0,0 -blank=all
